topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac4c316368724d62000335#post_55ac4c316368724d62000335

It comes to stamina and reach in those fights. A fast boxer can wear out the arms of the opponent with simple straights, even more if they have long reach.

Same with the strong ones, they can suck up the damage to tire them out or win via judge decision if it comes down to it.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4

topics.body: Saeki's punches are fast but they don't carry NEARLY as much weight to them as Ippo's.

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55ac4d246368723579000ce3#post_55ac4d246368723579000ce3
So it's like being faster, or being stronger. When you're fast, you can throw multiple punches, but they're weak and you have low defense, but you have great reflexes. When you're strong, you're a fucking tank, but you're slow as shit.
